member.name: T:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapClient
member.summary: An IMAP client that can be used to retrieve messages from a server.
member.remarks: The class supports both the "imap" and "imaps" protocols. The "imap" protocol makes a clear-text connection to the IMAP server and does not use SSL or TLS unless the IMAP server supports the STARTTLS extension (as defined by rfc3501). The "imaps" protocol, however, connects to the IMAP server using an SSL-wrapped connection.

member.name: M:MailKit.IMailService.Authenticate(System.Net.ICredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Authenticate using the supplied credentials.
member.remarks: If the service supports authentication, then the credentials are used to authenticate. Otherwise, this method simply returns.

member.name: M:MailKit.IMailService.AuthenticateAsync(System.Net.ICredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously authenticate using the supplied credentials.

remarks.para: If the server supports one or more SASL authentication mechanisms, then the SASL mechanisms that both the client and server support are tried in order of greatest security to weakest security. Once a SASL authentication mechanism is found that both client and server support, the credentials are used to authenticate.
If the server does not support SASL or if no common SASL mechanisms can be found, then the default login command is used as a fallback.

member.exception: The is not connected or is already authenticated.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
Authentication using the supplied credentials has failed.

member.param: If set to true, a "QUIT" command will be issued in order to disconnect cleanly.

member.param: If set to true, a logout/quit command will be issued in order to disconnect cleanly.

member.name: M:MailKit.IMailStore.EnableQuickResync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Enable the quick resynchronization feature.

remarks.para:
Enables quick resynchronization when a folder is opened using the
method.
If this feature is enabled, the event is replaced with the event.
This method needs to be called immediately after , before the opening of any folders.

member.exception: The is not connected, not authenticated, or a folder has been selected.
The mail store does not support quick resynchronization.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

member.summary: Enable the QRESYNC feature.

remarks.para:
The QRESYNC extension improves resynchronization performance of folders by querying the IMAP server for a list of changes when the folder is opened using the
method.
If this feature is enabled, the event is replaced with the event.
This method needs to be called immediately after , before the opening of any folders.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapClient.Authenticate(System.Net.ICredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Authenticate using the supplied credentials.

remarks.para: If the server supports one or more SASL authentication mechanisms, then the SASL mechanisms that both the client and server support are tried in order of greatest security to weakest security. Once a SASL authentication mechanism is found that both client and server support, the credentials are used to authenticate.
If the server does not support SASL or if no common SASL mechanisms can be found, then LOGIN command is used as a fallback.

member.exception: The is not connected or is already authenticated.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
Authentication using the supplied credentials has failed.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapClient.Connect(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Connect to the specified server.

remarks.para: Establishes a connection to an IMAP or IMAP/S server. If the schema in the uri is "imap", a clear-text connection is made and defaults to using port 143 if no port is specified in the URI. However, if the schema in the uri is "imaps", an SSL connection is made using the and defaults to port 993 unless a port is specified in the URI.

It should be noted that when using a clear-text IMAP connection, if the server advertizes support for the STARTTLS extension, the client will automatically switch into TLS mode before authenticating unless the contains a query string to disable it.

If the IMAP server advertizes the COMPRESS extension and either does not support the STARTTLS extension or the explicitly disabled the use of the STARTTLS extension, then the client will automatically opt into using a compressed data connection to optimize bandwidth usage unless the contains a query string to explicitly disable it.
If a successful connection is made, the and properties will be populated.

member.param: The server URI. The should either be "imap" to make a clear-text connection or "imaps" to make an SSL connection.
member.exception: The is not an absolute URI.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapClient.Idle(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Toggle the into the IDLE state.

remarks.para: When a client enters the IDLE state, the IMAP server will send events to the client as they occur on the selected folder. These events may include notifications of new messages arriving, expunge notifications, flag changes, etc.

Due to the nature of the IDLE command, a folder must be selected before a client can enter into the IDLE state. This can be done by opening a folder using
or any of the other variants.

member.param: The cancellation token used to return to the non-idle state.
member.exception: must be cancellable (i.e. cannot be used).
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
The server replied to the IDLE command with a NO or BAD response.
The server responded with an unexpected token.

member.name: M:MailKit.IMailFolder.Status(MailKit.StatusItems,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update the values of the specified items.

remarks.para: Updates the values of the specified items.
The method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the method to query for the list of unread messages.

The method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the method to query for the list of unread messages.

member.name: P:MailKit.IMailFolder.UidValidity
member.summary: Get the Unique ID validity.

remarks.para: UIDs are only valid so long as the UID validity value remains unchanged. If and when the folder's is changed, a client MUST discard its cache of UIDs along with any summary information that it may have and re-query the folder.
The will only be set after the folder has been opened.

member.name: P:MailKit.IMailFolder.UidNext
member.summary: Get the UID that the next message that is added to the folder will be assigned.
member.remarks: This value will only be set after the folder has been opened.

member.name: M:MailKit.MailFolder.Open(MailKit.FolderAccess,MailKit.UniqueId,System.UInt64,System.Collections.Generic.IList{MailKit.UniqueId},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Opens the folder using the requested folder access.

remarks.para: This variant of the method is meant for quick resynchronization of the folder. Before calling this method, the method MUST be called.
You should also make sure to add listeners to the and events to get notifications of changes since the last time the folder was opened.

member.param: The last known list of unique message identifiers.

exception.para: The is either not connected or not authenticated.
The quick resynchronization feature has not been enabled.

member.exception: The mail store does not support the quick resynchronization feature.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
The server's response contained unexpected tokens.

member.name: M:MailKit.MailFolder.Status(MailKit.StatusItems,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Update the values of the specified items.

remarks.para: Updates the values of the specified items.
The method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the method to query for the list of unread messages.

exception.para: The folder is not currently open.

member.exception: The mail store does not support the STATUS command.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

member.name: P:MailKit.MailFolder.UidValidity
member.summary: Get the UID validity.

remarks.para: UIDs are only valid so long as the UID validity value remains unchanged. If and when the folder's is changed, a client MUST discard its cache of UIDs along with any summary information that it may have and re-query the folder.
This value will only be set after the folder has been opened.

member.name: P:MailKit.MailFolder.UidNext

member.remarks: This value will only be set after the folder has been opened.

member.summary: Opens the folder using the requested folder access.

remarks.para: This variant of the method is meant for quick resynchronization of the folder. Before calling this method, the method MUST be called.
You should also make sure to add listeners to the and events to get notifications of changes since the last time the folder was opened.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapFolder.Status(MailKit.StatusItems,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates the values of the specified items.

remarks.para: Updates the values of the specified items.
The method MUST NOT be used on a folder that is already in the opened state. Instead, other ways of getting the desired information should be used.

For example, a common use for the method is to get the number of unread messages in the folder. When the folder is open, however, it is possible to use the method to query for the list of unread messages.

exception.para: The folder is not currently open.

member.exception: The IMAP server does not support the STATUS command.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Imap.ImapFolder.MoveTo(System.Collections.Generic.IList{MailKit.UniqueId},MailKit.IMailFolder,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Moves the specified messages to the destination folder.

remarks.para: If the IMAP server supports the MOVE command, then the MOVE command will be used. Otherwise, the messages will first be copied to the destination folder, then marked as \Deleted in the originating folder, and finally, if the server supports the UIDPLUS extension, expunged. Since the server could disconnect at any point between those 3 operations, it may be advisable to implement your own logic for moving messages in this case in order to better handle spontanious server disconnects and other error conditions.

member.returns: The UIDs of the messages in the destination folder, if available; otherwise an empty array.
member.param: The UIDs of the messages to move.

member.name: T:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities
member.summary: Capabilities supported by a POP3 server.
member.remarks: Capabilities are read as part of the response to the CAPA command that is issued during the connection and authentication phases of the .

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.None
member.summary: The server does not support any additional extensions.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Apop
member.summary: The server supports APOP authentication (rfc1939).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Expire
member.summary: The server supports the EXPIRE extension (rfc2449) and defines the expiration policy for messages (see ).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.LoginDelay
member.summary: The server supports the LOGIN-DELAY extension (rfc2449), allowing the server to specify to the client a minimum number of seconds between login attempts (see ).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Pipelining
member.summary: The server supports the PIPELINING extensions (rfc2449), allowing the client to batch multiple requests to the server at at time.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.ResponseCodes
member.summary: The server supports the RESP-CODES extension (rfc2449), allowing the server to provide clients with extended information in error responses.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Sasl
member.summary: The server supports the SASL authentication extension (rfc2449), allowing the client to authenticate using the advertized authentication mechanisms (see ).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.StartTLS
member.summary: The server supports the STLS extension (rfc2595), allowing clients to switch to an encrypted SSL/TLS connection after connecting.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Top
member.summary: The server supports the TOP command, allowing clients to fetch the headers plus an arbitrary number of lines.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.UIDL
member.summary: The server supports the UIDL command, allowing the client to refer to messages via a UID as opposed to a sequence ID.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.User
member.summary: The server supports the USER authentication command, allowing the client to authenticate via a plain-text username and password command (not recommended unless no other authentication mechanisms exist).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.UTF8
member.summary: The server supports the UTF8 extension (rfc6856), allowing clients to retrieve messages in the UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.UTF8User
member.summary: The server supports the UTF8 extension (rfc6856), allowing clients to authenticate using UTF-8 encoded usernames and passwords.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Capabilities.Lang
member.summary: The server supports the UTF8 extension (rfc6856), allowing clients to authenticate using UTF-8 encoded usernames and passwords and retrieve messages in the UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: T:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client
member.summary: A POP3 client that can be used to retrieve messages from a server.
member.remarks: The class supports both the "pop3" and "pop3s" protocols. The "pop3" protocol makes a clear-text connection to the POP3 server and does not use SSL or TLS unless the POP3 server supports the STLS extension (as defined by rfc2595). The "pop3s" protocol, however, connects to the POP3 server using an SSL-wrapped connection.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.Authenticate(System.Net.ICredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Authenticates using the supplied credentials.

remarks.para: If the POP3 server supports the APOP authentication mechanism, then APOP is used.

If the APOP authentication mechanism is not supported and the server supports one or more SASL authentication mechanisms, then the SASL mechanisms that both the client and server support are tried in order of greatest security to weakest security. Once a SASL authentication mechanism is found that both client and server support, the credentials are used to authenticate.
If the server does not support SASL or if no common SASL mechanisms can be found, then the USER and PASS commands are used as a fallback.

member.exception: The is not connected or is already authenticated.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
Authentication using the supplied credentials has failed.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.Connect(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the specified POP3 server.
member.remarks:
Establishes a connection to an POP3 or POP3/S server. If the schema in the uri is "pop", a clear-text connection is made and defaults to using port 110 if no port is specified in the URI. However, if the schema in the uri is "pops", an SSL connection is made using the and defaults to port 995 unless a port is specified in the URI.
It should be noted that when using a clear-text POP3 connection, if the server advertizes support for the STLS extension, the client will automatically switch into TLS mode before authenticating unless the contains a query string to disable it. If a successful connection is made, the and properties will be populated.
member.param: The server URI. The should either be "pop" to make a clear-text connection or "pops" to make an SSL connection.
member.exception: The is not an absolute URI.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.Capabilities
member.summary: Gets the capabilities supported by the POP3 server.
member.remarks: The capabilities will not be known until a successful connection has been made via the method and may change as a side-effect of the method.
member.exception: Capabilities cannot be enabled, they may only be disabled.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.ExpirePolicy
member.summary: Gets the expiration policy.

remarks.para: If the server supports the EXPIRE capability (), the value of the property will reflect the value advertized by the server.
A value of -1 indicates that messages will never expire.
A value of 0 indicates that messages that have been retrieved during the current session will be purged immediately after the connection is closed via the "QUIT" command.
Values larger than 0 indicate the minimum number of days that the server will retain messages which have been retrieved.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.Implementation
member.summary: Gets the implementation details of the server.
member.remarks: If the server advertizes its implementation details, this value will be set to a string containing the information details provided by the server.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.LoginDelay
member.summary: Gets the minimum delay, in milliseconds, between logins.
member.remarks: If the server supports the LOGIN-DELAY capability (), this value will be set to the minimum number of milliseconds that the client must wait between logins.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.AuthenticationMechanisms
member.summary: Gets the authentication mechanisms supported by the POP3 server.

remarks.para: The authentication mechanisms are queried durring the method.
Servers that do not support the SASL capability will typically support either the "APOP" authentication mechanism () or the ability to login using the "USER" and "PASS" commands ().

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for network streaming operations, in milliseconds.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the underlying socket stream's and values.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets whether or not the client is currently connected to an POP3 server.
member.remarks: When a is caught, the connection state of the should be checked before continuing.
member.value: true if the client is connected; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MailKit.Net.Pop3.Pop3Client.SupportsUids
member.summary: Gets whether or not the supports referencing messages by UIDs.

remarks.para: Not all servers support referencing messages by UID, so this property should be checked before using and .
If the server does not support UIDs, then all methods that take UID arguments along with and will fail.

member.value: true if supports UIDs; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities
member.summary: Capabilities supported by an SMTP server.
member.remarks: Capabilities are read as part of the response to the EHLO command that is issued during the connection phase of the .

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.None
member.summary: The server does not support any additional extensions.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.BinaryMime
member.summary: The server supports the BINARYMIME extension (rfc3030).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.Chunking
member.summary: The server supports the CHUNKING extension (rfc3030), allowing clients to upload messages in chunks.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.EightBitMime
member.summary: The server supports the 8BITMIME extension (rfc2821), allowing clients to send messages using the "8bit" Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.EnhancedStatusCodes
member.summary: The server supports the ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES extension (rfc2034).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.Authentication
member.summary: The server supports SASL AUTH extension.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.Pipelining
member.summary: The server supports the PIPELINING extension (rfc2920), allowing clients to send multiple commands at once in order to reduce round-trip latency.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.Size
member.summary: The server supports the SIZE extensions (rfc1870) and may have a maximum message size limitation (see ).

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.StartTLS
member.summary: The server supports the STARTTLS extension (rfc3207), allowing clients to switch to an encrypted SSL/TLS connection after connecting.

member.name: F:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpCapabilities.UTF8
member.summary: The server supports the SMTPUTF8 extension (rfc6531).

member.name: T:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpClient
member.summary: An SMTP client that can be used to send email messages.
member.remarks: The class supports both the "smtp" and "smtps" protocols. The "smtp" protocol makes a clear-text connection to the SMTP server and does not use SSL or TLS unless the SMTP server supports the STARTTLS extension (as defined by rfc3207). The "smtps" protocol, however, connects to the SMTP server using an SSL-wrapped connection.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpClient.Authenticate(System.Net.ICredentials,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Authenticates using the supplied credentials.

remarks.para: If the SMTP server supports authentication, then the SASL mechanisms that both the client and server support are tried in order of greatest security to weakest security. Once a SASL authentication mechanism is found that both client and server support, the credentials are used to authenticate.
If, on the other hand, authentication is not supported, then this method simply returns without attempting to authenticate.

member.exception: The is not connected or is already authenticated.
The SMTP server does not support authentication.
The operation was canceled via the cancellation token.
Authentication using the supplied credentials has failed.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpClient.Connect(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the specified SMTP server.
member.remarks:
Establishes a connection to an SMTP or SMTP/S server. If the schema in the uri is "smtp", a clear-text connection is made and defaults to using port 25 if no port is specified in the URI. However, if the schema in the uri is "smtps", an SSL connection is made using the and defaults to port 465 unless a port is specified in the URI.
It should be noted that when using a clear-text SMTP connection, if the server advertizes support for the STARTTLS extension, the client will automatically switch into TLS mode before authenticating unless the contains a query string to disable it. If a successful connection is made, the and properties will be populated.
member.param: The server URI. The should either be "smtp" to make a clear-text connection or "smtps" to make an SSL connection.
member.exception: The is not an absolute URI.

member.name: M:MailKit.Net.Smtp.SmtpClient.Disconnect(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Disconnect the service.
member.remarks: If is true, a "QUIT" command will be issued in order to disconnect cleanly.
member.param: If set to true, a "QUIT" command will be issued in order to disconnect cleanly.

member.summary: Indicates that OEM strings are supported for use in security buffer data.

member.summary: Requests that the server's authentication realm be included in the Type 2 message.

member.summary: This flag's usage has not been identified.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateSign
member.summary: Specifies that authenticated communication between the client and server should carry a digital signature (message integrity).

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateSeal
member.summary: Specifies that authenticated communication between the client and server should be encrypted (message confidentiality).

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateDatagramStyle
member.summary: Indicates that datagram authentication is being used.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateLanManagerKey
member.summary: Indicates that the Lan Manager Session Key should be used for signing and sealing authenticated communications.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateNetware
member.summary: This flag's usage has not been identified.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateNtlm
member.summary: Indicates that NTLM authentication is being used.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.UnknownFlag2
member.summary: This flag's usage has not been identified.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateAnonymous
member.summary: Sent by the client in the Type 3 message to indicate that an anonymous context has been established. This also affects the response fields.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateDomainSupplied
member.summary: Sent by the client in the Type 1 message to indicate that the name of the domain in which the client workstation has membership is included in the message. This is used by the server to determine whether the client is eligible for local authentication.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateWorkstationSupplied
member.summary: Sent by the client in the Type 1 message to indicate that the client workstation's name is included in the message. This is used by the server to determine whether the client is eligible for local authentication.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateLocalCall
member.summary: Sent by the server to indicate that the server and client are on the same machine. Implies that the client may use the established local credentials for authentication instead of calculating a response to the challenge.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateAlwaysSign
member.summary: Indicates that authenticated communication between the client and server should be signed with a "dummy" signature.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.TargetTypeDomain
member.summary: Sent by the server in the Type 2 message to indicate that the target authentication realm is a domain.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.TargetTypeServer
member.summary: Sent by the server in the Type 2 message to indicate that the target authentication realm is a server.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.TargetTypeShare
member.summary: Sent by the server in the Type 2 message to indicate that the target authentication realm is a share. Presumably, this is for share-level authentication. Usage is unclear.

member.name: F:MailKit.Security.Ntlm.NtlmFlags.NegotiateNtlm2Key
member.summary: Indicates that the NTLM2 signing and sealing scheme should be used for protecting authenticated communications. Note that this refers to a particular session security scheme, and is not related to the use of NTLMv2 authentication. This flag can, however, have an effect on the response calculations.

member.name: M:MailKit.Security.SaslMechanismScramBase.HMAC(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Apply the HMAC keyed algorithm.
member.remarks: HMAC(key, str): Apply the HMAC keyed hash algorithm (defined in [RFC2104]) using the octet string represented by "key" as the key and the octet string "str" as the input string. The size of the result is the hash result size for the hash function in use. For example, it is 20 octets for SHA-1 (see [RFC3174]).
member.returns: The results of the HMAC keyed algorithm.

member.summary: Apply the cryptographic hash function.

member.summary: Apply the exclusive-or operation to combine two octet strings.
member.remarks: Apply the exclusive-or operation to combine the octet string on the left of this operator with the octet string on the right of this operator. The length of the output and each of the two inputs will be the same for this use.

member.name: M:MailKit.BodyPartCollection.IndexOf(System.Uri)
member.summary: Gets the index of the body part matching the specified URI.

remarks.para: Finds the index of the body part matching the specified URI, if it exists.

If the URI scheme is "cid", then matching is performed based on the Content-Id header values, otherwise the Content-Location headers are used. If the provided URI is absolute and a child part's Content-Location is relative, then then the child part's Content-Location URI will be combined with the value of its Content-Base header, if available, otherwise it will be combined with the multipart/related part's Content-Base header in order to produce an absolute URI that can be compared with the provided absolute URI.

member.returns: The index of the part matching the specified URI if found; otherwise -1.
member.param: The URI of the body part.
